newsitem.title: USA: NFL AMERICAN FOOTBALL-RAIDERS BEAT CHARGERS FOR THIRD SUCCESSIVE VICTORY.
newsitem.headline: NFL AMERICAN FOOTBALL-RAIDERS BEAT CHARGERS FOR THIRD SUCCESSIVE VICTORY.

text.p: The Oakland defence limited the San Diego Chargers to a mere 29 yards rushing as the Raiders recorded their third consecutive victory, a 23-14 triumph on Monday night.

Cole Ford kicked his second of three field goals and Jeff Hostetler connected with Derrick Fenner on a 17-yard touchdown pass in a 10-0 third quarter that gave the Raiders a solid 20-7 lead heading into the fourth quarter.
Oakland, which began the season with a rocky 1-4 start, raised its record to 4-4 to move one-half game behind San Diego (4-3) for third place in the AFC West.
San Diego's starting quarterback Stan Humphries was knocked out in the first quarter with a separated left shoulder after being tackled by Oakland's Chester McGlockton.
Backup Sean Salisbury was 22-of-35 for 252 yards for the Chargers, connecting with Tony Martin for touchdown passes in the first and fourth quarters.

But that was all the offence the Chargers could muster as a fired up Oakland defence kept San Diego off the scoreboard in the second and third quarters. It was a far cry from the Chargers' wild 40-34 win in the first meeting between the AFC West rivals last month.

Napolean Kaufman, who ran for 56 yards on 13 carries, scored on a 12-yard run to give Oakland a 7-0 advantage just over three minutes into the game. The Chargers responded with Martin's first touchdown, an 11-yard catch that tied the score with three seconds left in the opening quarter.
Ford's 36-yard field goal 3:33 into the second gave the Raiders a 10-7 halftime lead.
In the third quarter, Hostetler directed an 8-play, 65-yard scoring drive. He was 20-of-33 for 191 yards with one touchdown and one interception.
Oakland linebacker Pat Swilling later recovered a fumble by Salisbury and returned it 49 yards to set up Ford's 32-yarder that made it 20-7.
Salisbury's 12-yard touchdown pass to Tony Martin -- his league-leading ninth touchdown reception -- pulled the Chargers within 20-14 just under two minutes into the fourth.
Martin also had catches of 25 and 31 yards on the 13-play, 79-yard scoring drive.
Ford third field goal, a 34-yarder with 2:11 left completed the scoring.
